result.execSummary:
The defendant Hugo Escalona-Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hugo Escalona-Cruz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hugo Escalona-Cruz was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Hugo Escalona-Cruz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 11 days served, if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay fine of $150.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges - on each count.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Perform 20 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hugo Escalona-Cruz

Revoked - Sentenced to KCJ/HOC
For Cts 3 & 4 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Gregory Bates and assisted by Spanish interpreter Alberto Aguilar.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 3 and 4 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1 and 2 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.   Sentenced to serve 6 months in Co. Jail on each count, concurrent;  sentences stayed, placed on probation for one year w/conditions.  Credit for 11 days served if probation is revoked.  $750 cash bond to apply to fine & costs due; any balance may be returned to the poster.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA M Drees
Final pre-trial on June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Per defendant's wife, defendant is incarcerated in Green Bay Co. Jail and will not be released until the end of May.  FPT on 4/10/15 at 9:00 in Br. 8 is removed from the calendar; to be rescheduled with Atty Bates and notice to be sent to defendant at his home address.  Interpreter needed for defendant for new hearing date.
